text:

Olympic medal tallies should count a gold as 3 points, silver as 2, and bronze as 1.

Celebrating 10 years üöÅüõ©Ô∏è

We‚Äôre on a mission to make flying every aircraft safe and simple, and that‚Äôs why we‚Äôve created SkyOS‚Ñ¢, the world‚Äôs first operating system for flight. 

We‚Äôre the only company to have developed aircraft-agnostic technology to make that future a reality, and 10 years in, we‚Äôve secured partnerships across every major aviation sector ‚Äì including the U.S. military, emergency medical service operators, law enforcement, private operators, including the largest firefighting agency in the world as well as international markets. 

By replacing conventional, complex mechanical flight controls in both helicopters and airplanes to support safe operations in all situations, including emergencies, SkyOS creates a synergistic partnership between human skill and intelligent automation, setting a new standard for safe aviation operations. 

SkyOS‚Äô impact reaches far beyond the cockpit, creating ripple effects that enhance public safety, strengthen national resilience, and accelerate the transition to a more sustainable, equitable future of air mobility.

quotedTweet.text:
This is one of the most underrated observations in tech right now. if AI commoditizes software, what's actually safe?
- regulated and liability-bearing businesses (someone has to be on the hook)
- anything touching the physical world (hardware, manufacturing, energy)
- proprietary data sets (AI makes your data more valuable, not less)
- marketplaces and businesses with network effects (liquidity > software)
- operationally intense businesses (the "bad" businesses become the best ones)
- cybersecurity and physical security (more AI = more attack surface)

We just raised $300M in Series C!

Helicopters and small planes are vastly less safe than large commercial aircraft. @Skyryse is bringing the safety of commercial aviation and the simplicity of driving an EV to the world of general aviation and military aviation. 

Several months ago, I joined the advisory board of Skyryse because I was super impressed by the management team and the scale of its mission. 

We set out to raise $150M Series C. Today, we announced the closing of an oversubscribed and upsized round of over $300M at $1.15B valuation, with a cap table that I'm very proud of. I can't wait to see Skyryse's 21st-century tech transform the aviation industry.
